Questions.Text: Clarity of workflow steps and ownership
Questions.MinMeaning: Workflow is confusing with unclear ownership
Questions.MaxMeaning: Workflow is clear, predictable, and well-owned

Questions.Text: Speed of approvals and decision making
Questions.MinMeaning: Approvals are slow and block progress
Questions.MaxMeaning: Approvals are fast and keep delivery moving

Questions.Text: Effectiveness of sprint planning and prioritization
Questions.MinMeaning: Planning frequently misaligns with business priorities
Questions.MaxMeaning: Planning is realistic and strongly aligned to priorities

Questions.Text: Practicality of policies in real daily work
Questions.MinMeaning: Policies are hard to apply day-to-day
Questions.MaxMeaning: Policies are practical and consistently applicable

Questions.Text: Impact of process on cross-team collaboration
Availability of tools and technical resources
Quality of documentation and knowledge base
Questions.MaxMeaning: Documentation is current and highly usable

Questions.MinMeaning: Blockers remain unresolved for long periods
Questions.MaxMeaning: Blockers are resolved quickly with high-quality support

Questions.Text: Process contribution to code quality and stability
